title: From kidney injury to cardiac dysfunction: the central role of oxidative stress in diabetes and CKD.
abstract: Both diabetes mellitus (DM) and chronic kidney disease (CKD) predispose to cardiac remodeling and coronary microvascular dysfunction, which is proposed to be mediated through increased oxidative stress. To link oxidative stress and cardiac remodeling in DM and CKD, CKD was induced in genetically modified DM swine (INS
